jobs.title: Enterprise Marketing Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Enode

The world’s energy use is changing - but the shift to renewables is too slow. Unlocking it requires smarter, more connected solutions.

Enode’s platform powers the next generation of green energy apps by connecting and optimizing the world’s energy devices through our APIs. From electric vehicles to heat pumps, we enable flexible demand that prioritises renewable energy.

We work with the world’s leading energy companies and green tech innovators, giving them instant access to over 250M+ consumers - and the ability to help millions of people use energy more sustainably.

With the urgent need to decarbonise, there has never been a more critical time for Enode. That’s why we’re backed by leading investors like Y Combinator, Lowercarbon Capital, and Creandum.

Yet, we’re just getting started - and we’re looking for builders and innovators to join our mission-driven, passionate team.

About the role

We’re hiring an Enterprise Marketing Lead to help drive Enode’s next stage of growth. This is a high-impact role that will lead our GTM efforts across content, positioning, and campaigns, with a strong focus on supporting our enterprise expansion.

You’ll partner closely with our CRO, Thorvald, and Mikaela, our Head of Marketing, as well as our product, partnerships and wider leadership team to bring clarity to our messaging, structure to our marketing execution, and commercial impact across channels.

You’ll report to our Head of Marketing and be a key senior member of a small, high-performing team. This role will evolve over time with continued scope and strategic ownership.

The exact areas of ownership will evolve based on your strengths and interests, but likely include:

  • Evolving Enode’s commercial messaging across channels and teams

  • Leading content planning and execution (case studies, sales materials, thought leadership)

  • Driving GTM coordination for new products, features, and integrations

  • Collaborating with Sales and Product teams to support enterprise deal cycles

  • Prioritising, planning and shipping integrated campaigns tied to revenue goals

  • Building clarity around marketing metrics, reporting, and quarterly planning

  • Contributing to marketing operations and overall team structure

About you

We’re looking for a mission-motivated, structured, analytical and highly logical marketer. You should be ambitious, driven to make an impact, and focused on bringing ideas to life. We’re not expecting you to have experience that maps directly to our context, but we’re looking for someone who is naturally curious and motivated to take on the challenge of helping us build our early GTM Marketing engine.

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Has 5–8 years of B2B SaaS Marketing experience in high-ownership environments

  • Has worked across multiple Marketing crafts: GTM, content, campaigns, and messaging

  • Understands Enterprise Sales Cycles and how Marketing can support them

  • Has strong collaboration skills and experience working closely with Sales and Product

  • Is both strategic and tactical: you can plan and deliver

  • Writes and communicates clearly, bringing structure through ambiguity

  • Can strategically plan and prioritize marketing roadmap

  • (Nice to have) Experience in climate, energy or regulated infrastructure markets

  • (Nice to have) Can track content/campaign impact, set basic KPIs and surfacing learnings

What we offer:

  • Opportunity to join and impact an early-stage climate tech startup with global aspirations as we scale.

  • A mission-driven, fun and caring environment with high drive and ambition.

  • Competitive compensation, including a very attractive employee option program - you’re part of our journey.

  • Remote-first in Europe, with the option of attending an office in Oslo or receiving a co-working pass on demand.

  • Three annual off-sites to connect with the team in exciting & fun places.

  • Flexible, human-first culture.

  • Stipend for setting up your home office.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A few things to note:

  • Enode is an equal opportunities employer. Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

  • Our values are integral to the way we work and are embedded into all our hiring processes. You can read more about our values here.

ABOUT ENODE

The world’s energy use is changing - but the shift to renewables is too slow. Unlocking it requires smarter, more connected solutions.

Enode’s https://www.enode.io/about platform powers the next generation of green energy apps by connecting and optimizing the world’s energy devices through our APIs. From electric vehicles to heat pumps, we enable flexible demand that prioritises renewable energy.

We work with the world’s leading energy companies and green tech innovators, giving them instant access to over 250M+ consumers - and the ability to help millions of people use energy more sustainably.

With the urgent need to decarbonise, there has never been a more critical time for Enode. That’s why we’re backed by leading investors like Y Combinator, Lowercarbon Capital, and Creandum.

Yet, we’re just getting started - and we’re looking for builders and innovators to join our mission-driven, passionate team.


ABOUT THE ROLE

We’re hiring an Enterprise Marketing Lead to help drive Enode’s next stage of growth. This is a high-impact role that will lead our GTM efforts across content, positioning, and campaigns, with a strong focus on supporting our enterprise expansion.

You’ll partner closely with our CRO, Thorvald https://www.linkedin.com/in/thorvald-thorsnes/, and Mikaela https://www.linkedin.com/in/mikaela-sievertz/, our Head of Marketing, as well as our product, partnerships and wider leadership team to bring clarity to our messaging, structure to our marketing execution, and commercial impact across channels.

You’ll report to our Head of Marketing and be a key senior member of a small, high-performing team. This role will evolve over time with continued scope and strategic ownership.

The exact areas of ownership will evolve based on your strengths and interests, but likely include:

 - Evolving Enode’s commercial messaging across channels and teams

 - Leading content planning and execution (case studies, sales materials, thought leadership)

 - Driving GTM coordination for new products, features, and integrations

 - Collaborating with Sales and Product teams to support enterprise deal cycles

 - Prioritising, planning and shipping integrated campaigns tied to revenue goals

 - Building clarity around marketing metrics, reporting, and quarterly planning

 - Contributing to marketing operations and overall team structure


ABOUT YOU

We’re looking for a mission-motivated, structured, analytical and highly logical marketer. You should be ambitious, driven to make an impact, and focused on bringing ideas to life. We’re not expecting you to have experience that maps directly to our context, but we’re looking for someone who is naturally curious and motivated to take on the challenge of helping us build our early GTM Marketing engine.

We’re looking for someone who:

 - Has 5–8 years of B2B SaaS Marketing experience in high-ownership environments

 - Understands Enterprise Sales Cycles and how Marketing can support them

 - Has strong collaboration skills and experience working closely with Sales and Product

 - Is both strategic and tactical: you can plan and deliver

 - Writes and communicates clearly, bringing structure through ambiguity

 - Can strategically plan and prioritize marketing roadmap

 - (Nice to have) Experience in climate, energy or regulated infrastructure markets

 - (Nice to have) Can track content/campaign impact, set basic KPIs and surfacing learnings


WHAT WE OFFER:

 - Opportunity to join and impact an early-stage climate tech startup with global aspirations as we scale.

 - A mission-driven, fun and caring environment with high drive and ambition.

 - Competitive compensation, including a very attractive employee option program - you’re part of our journey.

 - Remote-first in Europe, with the option of attending an office in Oslo or receiving a co-working pass on demand.

 - Three annual off-sites to connect with the team in exciting & fun places.

 - Flexible, human-first culture.

 - Stipend for setting up your home office.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


A FEW THINGS TO NOTE:

 - Enode is an equal opportunities employer. Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

 - Our values are integral to the way we work and are embedded into all our hiring processes. You can read more about our values here https://enode.com/careers.

jobs.title: Business Operations & Automation Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Enode

The world’s energy use is changing - but the shift to renewables is too slow. Unlocking it requires smarter, more connected solutions.

Enode’s platform powers the next generation of green energy apps by connecting and optimizing the world’s energy devices through our APIs. From electric vehicles to heat pumps, we enable flexible demand that prioritises renewable energy.

We work with the world’s leading energy companies and green tech innovators, giving them instant access to over 250M+ consumers - and the ability to help millions of people use energy more sustainably.

With the urgent need to decarbonise, there has never been a more critical time for Enode. That’s why we’re backed by leading investors like Y Combinator, Lowercarbon Capital, and Creandum.

Yet, we’re just getting started - and we’re looking for builders and innovators to join our mission-driven, passionate team.

What we’re looking for:

We’re hiring Business Operations & Automation Engineer to drive pivotal projects across the business, and be a critical multiplier that enables Enode to scale. This is a high-impact, high-visibility role that will work cross-functionally with teams, such as Revenue and Finance, and executives to build processes, metrics tracking, automation and AI-driven solutions across the business.

You will focus heavily on introducing important automations into our Finance function within the first 3-6 months, with ample opportunity to expand in scope to work with Revenue and other teams as your role evolves.

As the second hire into our Operations function, you’ll be working directly with Tim Finney, Henrik Langeland and other teams/executives across the business. This role offers meaningful impact in a fast-growing, early-stage climate-tech to help shape our foundations and future trajectory.

In this role, you will:

Automation, AI & Enablement

  • Design and implement automation workflows to reduce manual overhead (e.g., invoicing, reconciliation, reporting for Finance, funnel and data hygiene, revenue dashboards for GTM)

  • Evaluate, integrate, and maintain AI/automation tools that streamline financial and operational workflows

  • Support budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis with dynamic, data-driven models

  • Assist with board, investor, and audit reporting, streamlining data collection and improving quality through automation

  • Ensure data accuracy by partnering with external accounting providers and managing systems integrations

  • Prototype and deploy lightweight LLM-powered agents (e.g., GPT, Claude) to automate internal operations or decision-making

  • Act as an internal consultant with stakeholders across finance, ops, and other functions to identify and act on high-impact automation opportunities

Operational Execution

  • Act as the operational glue across teams, surfacing blockers, driving accountability, and improving handoffs

  • Step into ambiguous operational gaps, bring structure, and implement sustainable solutions without waiting for permission

Data & Performance Analytics

  • Define and evolve real-time dashboards for company-wide metrics and OKRs

  • Lead deep-dive analyses on business performance and operational bottlenecks

  • Partner with team leads to deliver data solutions that improve decision-making

  • Build lightweight internal tools (dashboards, scripts, mini-apps) to support cross-functional initiatives

This role will be right for you, if:

You are an ambitious, analytically minded generalist with either a technical background or a distinct interest in data, automation tooling and AI. We’re not expecting the ideal candidate to have experience in enacting projects across all the areas we have set out above - but we are looking for technically-minded, first principles thinkers who enjoy building innovative solutions to startup problems.

You have:

  • Experience in a hybrid technical/business role, ideally with:

    • A foundation in consulting, finance, or operations (e.g., strategy, FP&A, bizops)

    • Hands-on experience in startups or tech-forward teams

  • Fluency in spreadsheets and modern data tools (Excel, SQL, Equals, Snowflake, Notion, etc.)

  • Obsessed with new technology, AI, LLMs, automation APIs, and AI agents, and how it can be leveraged to drive efficiency and business outcomes

  • Usage of tools such as n8n, Retool, Make, Zapier, to drive automated processes or internal platforms

  • Self-starter mentality with the ability to navigate ambiguity and prioritize autonomously

  • Process and execution-oriented, with a proven ability to drive initiatives from conception to completion

  • Strong understanding of SaaS business models and recurring revenue metrics

  • Bonus: experience with programming or scripting languages (e.g., Python, JavaScript)

What we offer:

  • Opportunity to join and impact an early-stage climate tech startup with global aspirations as we scale.

  • A mission-driven, fun and caring environment with high drive and ambition.

  • Competitive compensation, including a very attractive employee option program - you’re part of our journey.

  • Remote-first in Europe, with the option of attending an office in Oslo or receiving a co-working pass on demand.

  • Three annual off-sites to connect with the team in exciting & fun places.

  • Flexible, human-first culture.

  • Stipend for setting up your home office.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A few things to note:

  • Enode is an equal opportunities employer. Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

  • Our values are integral to the way we work and are embedded into all our hiring processes. You can read more about our values here.
